soilDescription: Loamy soil is rich in nutrients, well-drained, and ideal for agriculture.
Sandy soil has large particles, is quick-draining, and suitable for certain crops like peanuts.
Clay soil retains water well but is prone to waterlogging and compaction.
Silty soil has fine particles, good water retention, and is fertile for farming.
Peaty soil is rich in organic matter, acidic, and good for horticulture.
Chalky soil is alkaline, drains quickly, and may require additional nutrients for farming.
Saline soil has high salt content and poses challenges for plant growth.
Desert soil is sandy, has low fertility, and is found in arid regions.
Alluvial soil is fertile and typically found near rivers, making it excellent for agriculture.
Black soil is rich in calcium carbonate and suitable for growing cotton.
